alert.note: Alert for Blair; Cambria; Clearfield; Huntingdon; Juniata; Mifflin; Northern Centre; Somerset; Southern Centre (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 9:25AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...BANDS OF HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN CENTRE... SOMERSET...CLEARFIELD...BLAIR...CAMBRIA...JUNIATA...HUNTINGDON... MIFFLIN...AND SOUTHERN CENTRE COUNTIES... HAZARDS...Bands of heavy snow showers which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 923 AM EDT, bands of heavy snow were crossing parts of the South Central Mountains and Laurel Highlands, moving east at 40 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Sinking Valley around 930 AM EDT. Birmingham, Warriors Mark and Bald Eagle around 935 AM EDT. Spruce Creek and Franklinville around 940 AM EDT. Huntingdon around 955 AM EDT. Mcalevys Fort around 1005 AM EDT. Allensville and Belleville around 1010 AM EDT. * This includes the following Interstates... The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 100 to 118. Interstate 99 from mile markers 27 to 61. SAFETY INFO... Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are expected. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Blair; Cambria; Clearfield; Huntingdon; Juniata; Mifflin; Northern Centre; Somerset; Southern Centre
